page.title: 12Armed Forces. Transport.
page.content: Although none are actually stationed within the area boundaries,the loca- tion of the R.E.M.E.at Bordon and the Army Cadet Headquarters at Longmoor affects the area by the occupation of land in the extreme SW as firing ranges. This restricts use of public footpaths at firing times and excludes all entry by the public during exercises. A useful service to the community is provided by a family concern operating taxis and mini-buses for local and long distance journeys. The business grew out of a taxi service established about 40 years ago;in its present form the firm also supplies airline and theatre tickets and a personal courier service. It is contracted to the County for the provision of school buses. A car is regarded as a necessity.
